programme.title: Virginia @ North Carolina
programme.desc: Men's college basketball action.

programme.title: Virginia Tech @ Duke
programme.desc: The Hokies (16-12, 6-11 ACC) target a third straight win over the Blue Devils (20-8, 11-6). Virginia Tech leading scorer Grant Basile posted 24 points in a 78-75 home triumph over Duke on Jan. 23. Kyle Filipowski (DUKE) had a 29-point double-double.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Olivia Miles and the No. 10 Fighting Irish face the Cardinals. Notre Dame has won five in a row, including a 78-76 result versus Louisville on Feb. 16. Miles hit the winner at the buzzer in overtime, and finished an assist shy of a triple-double.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Big Ten powers in the No. 2 Hoosiers (26-1, 16-1) and No. 6 Hawkeyes (22-6, 14-3) finish their regular seasons. Iowa comes off a 96-68 loss at No. 7 Maryland. The Hoosiers halted a three-game slide against the Hawkeyes with an 87-78 victory Feb. 9.

programme.title: XFL Football
programme.sub-title: San Antonio Brahmas at Orlando Guardians
programme.desc: Coverage of football action from around the XFL.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Bold opinions, discussion and debate centered on the top storylines from around the league. Mike Greenberg hosts this pregame show with analysts Stepen A. Smith, Jalen Rose and Michael Wilbon.

programme.title: Timberwolves @ Warriors
programme.sub-title: Minnesota Timberwolves at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: The Warriors and Timberwolves tangle in a clash of Western Conference playoff contenders. The clubs split the first two meetings this season, both in Minneapolis. Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards totaled 53 points and nine assists in those games.

programme.title: Clippers @ Nuggets
programme.sub-title: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: The Northwest Division-leading Nuggets aim to maintain their dominance of the Clippers. Denver seeks the regular-season sweep after besting LA by 53 points over three games earlier in the campaign. Jamal Murray (DEN) averaged 21 points in those wins.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 1 South Carolina (28-0, 15-0 SEC) aims to cap a perfect regular season by facing Georgia (20-9, 9-6). The Lady Bulldogs have won five in a row, but fell 68-51 to the Gamecocks on Jan. 2. Zia Cooke (SC) roasted Georgia for 31 points in that win.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series crosses the country for the Production Alliance Group 300 at the Auto Club Speedway in California. Georgia native Austin Hill sits atop the point standings after claiming his second straight season-opening win at Daytona.

programme.title: DePaul @ Marquette
programme.desc: The No. 10 Golden Eagles take on the Blue Demons. Marquette has won eight of its last nine, including an 89-69 verdict over DePaul on Jan. 28. Sophomore forward David Joplin (MARQ) netted 28 points off the bench, including 8-of-11 shooting from deep.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cowgirls end their 2022-23 regular season by playing the Rams. The schools are battling for the second seed in the Mountain West Tournament behind UNLV. McKenna Hofschild scored 25 points for Colorado State in a 66-63 win over Wyoming on Feb. 4.

programme.title: The Perfect 10
programme.desc: The 10 legendary football icons who have achieved one of the rarest dual accomplishments -- winning the coveted Heisman Trophy and being enshrined in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

programme.title: Indiana @ Purdue
programme.desc: No. 5 Purdue (24-4, 13-4) seeks revenge on No. 17 Indiana (19-9, 10-7) in a Big Ten affair among Hoosier State rivals. Indiana topped Purdue 79-74 on Feb. 4 behind 25 points by Trayce Jackson-Davis. The Boilermakers are 13-1 at Mackey Arena.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Huskies try to bounce back against the Blue Demons. UConn has two conference losses in a season for the first time since 2012-13 after a stunning loss at home to St. John's. Aneesah Morrow (DEP) is scoring 25.7 points per game this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series crosses the country for the Production Alliance Group 300 at the Auto Club Speedway in California. Georgia native Austin Hill sits atop the point standings after claiming his second straight season-opening win at Daytona.

programme.title: Motorcycle Racing
programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub: 75 Years of Racing
programme.desc: A look back at 75 years of NASCAR highlights.

programme.title: NASCAR Presents
programme.desc: NASCAR Race Hub presents inspiring stories about the history and legends of NASCAR. Season 8 of the Beyond the Wheel Short Films series includes Vintage to Vogue, Evolution - Stock Car to Racecar and Beating the Odds - The Ernie Irvan Story.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Cup Series race.

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Following all the action from the world of horse racing.

programme.title: Washington @ Stanford
programme.desc: The Cardinal complete the home portion of their schedule when the Huskies visit the Farm for a Pac-12 engagement. Washington stopped Stanford 86-69 in January. Huskies 7-foot-1 junior Braxton Meah scored 21 points in that game, 16 on dunks.
